definition: to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to choose/to pick/to select/to elect

sentences.english: He himself is a perennial Nobel also-ran.
sentences.chinese: 他自己就长年是诺贝尔和平奖落选者。

sentences.english: They qualified for the qualifying tourney by their finish in last year's regional tournaments.
sentences.chinese: 他们通过去年的地区选拔赛获得了落选锦标赛的资格。

sentences.english: Chen Zhonghe, mostly favored, was elected out unexpectedly and lost the election for another term.
sentences.chinese: 呼声最高的陈忠和意外落选，失去了连任的机会。

sentences.english: People can argue about why Mayor Fenty lost after one term.
sentences.chinese: 人们对芬蒂在一届任期后便落选可能会有所争议。

sentences.english: She ran as a pro-choice Republican and lost narrowly.
sentences.chinese: 她以亲共和党的身份参选，以微弱差距落选。

sentences.english: Jermaine Pennant has revealed his disappointment after being overlooked for England once again.
sentences.chinese: 再次落选英格兰队，彭南特难以掩饰失望之情。

sentences.english: I bet her ￡200 that she would lose the vote.
sentences.chinese: 我拿200英镑和她打赌，说她在选举中肯定落选。

sentences.english: The Company will dispose personal data of all unsuccessful applicants.
sentences.chinese: 所有落选者之个人资料将被本公司弃除。

sentences.english: At the second year's examination, he was not classed at all.
sentences.chinese: 他在第二年的考试中落选了，不能被编班。

sentences.english: More than half will end up losers on election night.
sentences.chinese: 而超过一半将会在竞选之夜落选。

sentences.english: Troops to school recruiting, fine sister, lily but was rejected.
sentences.chinese: 部队来学校招兵，细妹入选，莉莉却落选。

sentences.english: He has already lost two general elections and his party, unsurprisingly, seethes with barely contained rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 他已经两度落选，人民党也无疑叛念中烧。

definition: to fail the imperial exams/to flunk
to get past the qualifying round/to make it to the finals
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
to have no opportunity/no way (of doing sth)/no chance/no connection/not placed (in a competition)/(in pop lyrics) no chance of love, no place to be together etc
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
candidate (attributive)
list of names
to be chosen/to be elected as
primary election
to be elected/to be selected
to nominate
to win a prize
candidate/CL:名[ming2]
to lose/to suffer defeat
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
